intro_text: Padding through the forest at night on a dare, the apprentices gasp as light streaks across the sky. A StarClan cat has fallen!
decline_text: Before the apprentices can pursue the fallen StarClan cat, the worst of all possibilities happens - a warrior discovers them, sending them back to camp with a loud scolding.

success_outcomes.text: Scrambling up the hill, app1 shoves app2 up a slightly too big step, both of them panting eagerly as they run. The mist swirls around them, stinking strangely as they search for the StarClan cat, until app2 bumps into a huge, tall pillar, one that blinks down with slow, glowing red eyes.

fail_outcomes.text: app2 gets stuck on a big stone step as the apprentices try to scramble uphill - and by the time they climb up, only the dissipating, strangely scented mist says that anything magical passed through here at all.

intro_text: As the patrol pads along the border, r_c nearly topples over, falling into a footprint twice as wide and three times as long as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is}.
decline_text: r_c scrambles back to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} feet, ears twitching back in embarrassment. Whatever made these tracks is no cat, so it's not relevant for the border patrol's marking mission.

success_outcomes.text: The border patrol is immediately diverted to tracking this new unknown - with feet the size of a small dog, c_n needs to know what this thing is. It takes every bit of their talents at tracking through the woods, but the cats catch a glimpse of a giant, furred Twoleg, crossing a distant clearing and disappearing forever.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol pursues the footprints, tracking them through the forest from deep toeprints in mud to hair caught on high branches, but don't manage to catch up to whatever made them.

intro_text: As r_c is out alone, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/spot/spots} something out of the corner of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eye; spindly, long, and partially hidden by the undergrowth of the forest.
decline_text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/hurry/hurries} back to camp, a little freaked out.

success_outcomes.text: It leaps up onto a fallen log - whatever it is, bulbous head, long, spindly limbs, pale, hairless skin like a skink. r_c hisses, and it echoes in a whisper, skittering off into the woods.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c doesn't want to talk about it when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/come/comes} back to camp. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} want to talk about anything.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died of shock after {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} encounter with the Dover Demon.
history_text.lead_death: died of shock from an encounter with the Dover Demon

intro_text: The patrol is on edge after scenting Twolegs in the area. p_l is taking point, cautiously keeping watch for any Twolegs that may be on the hunt for cats. Their scent is everywhere, even as the cats carefully remark the area. What's that smell? It's almost like pumpkin, but strange...
decline_text: p_l knows better than to mess with anything that smells like Twolegs. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} carefully {VERB/p_l/skirt/skirts} the area.

success_outcomes.text: p_l follows the scent and nearly treads on the sticky thing in the grass. Definitely a weird Twoleg thing. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} carefully {VERB/p_l/walk/walks} around it, unwilling to get the sticky stuff in {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} fur.

p_l finds the sticky thing in the grass and looks at it curiously. s_c suddenly appears beside {PRONOUN/p_l/object} and, before p_l can tell {PRONOUN/s_c/object} to be careful, s_c bends down and takes a lick. This proves to be a bad idea. s_c wrinkles {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} nose and gags, trying to spit the disgusting taste out of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} mouth.

fail_outcomes.text: As p_l creeps closer to get a better look, a sudden crashing and loud chattering fills the air. p_l freezes as a pack of Twolegs stumbles through the trees. The cats quickly scatter, leaving behind whatever that weird thing was in the grass.

intro_text: Recently, r_c has been hearing rumors that there is a badger denning in c_n's territory near their border with o_c_n.
decline_text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/note/notes} the area as a place to avoid and make sure the borders are freshly marked.

success_outcomes.text: Concerned for the Clan, r_c creeps through the woods, searching for the sett. It's empty when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/arrive/arrives}, its owner out foraging late. The sunlight blinds the beast as it fumbles its way back, and r_c attacks - but all it gives {PRONOUN/r_c/object} is the opportunity for a lucky hit and an easy retreat, and r_c must give up the idea of saving the Clan single-pawedly.

s_c, despite having been told that a full patrol would investigate, decides to check out the badger area alone. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/don't/doesn't} think it'd be that hard to smell the stench of a badger, so as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} got closer, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/take/takes} a deep breath in, and pick up the unmistakable scent of the new occupant. Satisfied, s_c returns to inform {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clan of the badger.
s_c remembered that a full patrol was supposed to be sent to investigate, so stayed away from the section of woods rumored to be home to the badger.

s_c trembled, swallowing as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/look/looks} towards the rumored badger sett, hidden partially by some rather thick overgrowth. s_c knew that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/weren't/wasn't} the bravest, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} wanted to prove that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} could be brave. So with nervous steps, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/creep/creeps} forward, and as soon as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/get/gets} a sign of the sett being active, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/flee/flees} back to camp to inform {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clan what {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} found.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/set/sets} to yowling, challenging the beast to come out and fight until it emerges, grumbling and blinking in the sunlight. While s_c manages to get several good swipes in, the badger holds its ground, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/return/returns} to camp deflated.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/set/sets} to yowling, challenging the beast to come out and fight. But after several minutes of yowling, s_c has to admit that the sett is likely empty, both disappointed and relieved to not have to fight a badger.

As {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/approach/approaches} the section of the woods that borders o_c_n, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/get/gets} the sense of approaching doom, a gut feeling that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'ve/'s} learnt to trust, and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/decide/decides} that it would be better to avoid the area instead.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/hunt/hunts} for some prey nearby to set in front of the sett, before backing away to see if the badger comes out to investigate the scent. It wasn't long before s_c could hear thuds of the lumbering beast as it came out to eat the prey. Knowledge in paw, s_c returns to camp with this knowledge.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/hunt/hunts} for some prey nearby to set in front of the sett, before backing away to see if the badger comes out to investigate the scent. Even after an hour of careful watching, nothing came out, and r_c determines the sett was empty of the predator. Knowledge in paw, s_c returns to camp with this knowledge.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/begin/begins} to climb up one of the trees that would provide a good vantage point. Then {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/wait/waits}, keeping a careful eye on the sett until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/determine/determines} the sett is empty and heads back to camp, relieved that the sett is empty.

Worried about {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates, s_c sets out to try to solve the problem on {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} own. Once {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/find/finds} the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/begin/begins} to climb up one of the trees that would provide a good vantage point. Then {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/wait/waits}, keeping a careful eye on the sett until {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/determine/determines} the sett is occupied and heads back to camp.

Even as s_c approaches the area rumored to have the badger, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} could already see signs of the occupant. Not wanting to tangle with the beast alone, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/head/heads} back to camp to inform {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} clanmates.

s_c sets out to separate truth from rumor. There are fresh tracks in the mud under the canopy, but they're smaller than s_c expected. To confirm {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} theory, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/stake/stakes} out the sett itself, and when the beast pokes its head out at night, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} able to confirm it's a juvenile - young and inexperienced. s_c pads quietly back to camp with the intel.
r_c pokes around, looking for the rumored badger sett, but finds nothing. Not a single whiff of badger or it's scat. Relieved, r_c returns to the camp to inform them the rumor is false.

While s_c is carefully sniffing at the burrow entrance, there's a rustle from the woods behind {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. It's difficult to say who's more surprised - s_c or the badger. It charges for the sett and s_c leaps out of the way, running as fast as {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} could back to camp to let the clan know.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c pokes around, looking for the rumored badger sett, but finds nothing. Despite there being no sign, r_c couldn't help but feel like {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} missed something.

r_c pokes around, looking for the rumored badger sett, and although {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/found/finds} a fresh badger scent, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} didn't see the beast, leaving {PRONOUN/r_c/object} unsure if this was where the badger lived, or if it had just been passing through.

Well, the only way to know is to check! Once s_c finds the sett, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/scramble/scrambles} inside for a look and comes nose to nose with its occupant. It's only by the grace of StarClan that {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} able to redirect that speed to twist around just as fast, shedding fur in clumps as the badger's furious snarling and fizzing follows {PRONOUN/s_c/object} up the burrow tunnel.

r_c carefully approaches the burrow, trying to figure out if there's anything inside. It's so dark, and it all smells the same... {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/try/tries} to creep just a little closer - but the ground drops away steeply beneath {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/lose/loses} {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} footing, skidding right into the disturbed badger's lethal jaws.

history_text.reg_death: m_c lost {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {PRONOUNG/m_c/lose/loses} {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} footing in the darkness of a badger sett and slide into the jaws of a badger.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c carefully approaches the area to investigate. They creep into the burrow, and identify the fresh smells, but when they come out, they come face to face with the occupant, and the badger's face was the last thing that r_c ever saw.

history_text.reg_death: m_c lost {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} came face to face with a badger after investigating the badger's sett.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by coming face to face with a badger

Turning around, s_c only had time to widen {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eyes in shock before vicious claws slashed over {PRONOUN/s_c/object}.

history_text.reg_death: m_c lost {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decided to investigate rumors of a badger alone.

Turning around, s_c only has time to widen {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} eyes in shock before vicious claws slash over {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} face. Yowling in pain, s_c {VERB/s_c/flee/flees} back to camp.

history_text.reg_death: m_c lost {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life due to complications from an injury gotten when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decided to investigate rumors of a badger alone.
history_text.lead_death: {VERB/m_c/were/was} killed by injuries from investigating a badger

fail_outcomes.text: While r_c is carefully sniffing at the burrow entrance, there's a rustle from the woods behind {PRONOUN/r_c/object}. It's difficult to say who's more surprised - r_c or the badger. It charges for the sett and r_c leaps out of the way, but its claws catch {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} pelt, and it's a bloodied cat that limps back into camp to report the whole sorry adventure.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred by a badger.
history_text.reg_death: m_c lost {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life from injuries sustained by a badger attack when {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} {VERB/m_c/were/was} investigating rumors.
